record.id: field.name="work.rng.min" and file.name="validity" and term=NULL and format.name=NULL and syslanguage="en"
record.field.name: work.rng.min
record.file.name: validity

brief.brief: A processing statement to determine the minimum value of the range.

detail.detail: Normally, the syntax of the statement is:
In this case, $vrfield contains the value of Field Name in the record being validated, ? is the comparison operator (=, >, <, ~), and value is the actual minimum value.
To have a valid range, you must define both a Range Min and Range Max.
For example, to validate that a field is not NULL (empty), specify the Range Max as true and the Range Min as:
- When the field is NULL, the Range Min condition is false. Since true AND false is false, if the field is NULL, it is not valid.
- When the field is not NULL, the Range Min condition is true. Since true AND true is true, if the field is not NULL, it is valid.
